title.narrative: Shanxi Energy Efficiency and Environment Improvement Project

description.narrative: The proposed project will improve energy efficiency and reduce emission of greenhouse gases and other pollutants in Shanxi province by introducing and expanding district heating in five urban areas and expanding the coal-mine methane (CMM) gas supply and distribution network in one of these areas. The project follows and complements two previous Asian Development Bank (ADB) projects in the province, which have been completed successfully.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Better air quality and reduced greenhouse gases emission in five urban areas in Shanxi province

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

By 2018, district heating in the five urban areas reduces aggregate annual coal consumption by 53,493 t, thereby avoiding annual emissions of 133,358 t of CO2, 2,677 t of SO2, 802 t of NOx, 10,534 t of TSP, compared with 2012.

description.narrative: Better air quality and reduced greenhouse gases emission in five urban areas in Shanxi province

title.narrative: By 2018, the CMM distribution system in Liulin city reduces annual coal consumption by 31,897 t, thereby avoiding annual emissions of 121,021 t of CO2, 1,444 t of SO2, 1,140 t of NOx, and 5,700 t of TSP, compared with 2012.

description.narrative: Better air quality and reduced greenhouse gases emission in five urban areas in Shanxi province

title.narrative: By 2018, the five urban areas improve their record, by at least 20%, in meeting class IIa air quality standards (2012 baseline - days standards are met during heating season : Jinzhong- 69, Licheng- 68, Qin- 73, Zhongyang- 70, Liulin- 70)

description.narrative: Better air quality and reduced greenhouse gases emission in five urban areas in Shanxi province
